items.title: What if all providers were equal?
items.content:
You'd design: Use cheapest model for everything.
Why this fails: Models have different strengths. Claude excels at reasoning, GPT at code, local at privacy.
Hidden constraint: Provider diversity IS the feature, not a workaround.

items.title: Optimization vs. Simplicity
items.content:
Claude Code: Simple setup, single provider, native features
OpenCode: Complex config, any provider, DIY features

Choose based on: How much do you value simplicity vs. flexibility?

items.title: OpenCode: 78K GitHub stars
items.content: SST (Serverless Stack) created OpenCode. 600+ contributors. Most popular open-source coding agent by stars. Community-driven development.

items.title: BYOK forces architecture decisions
items.content:
ROOT: "Bring Your Own Key" philosophy
→ No hosted service
→ Client/server architecture
→ Provider abstraction layer
→ Config-driven tool permissions
→ Session persistence for remote execution

items.title: OpenCode = Database Abstraction
items.content:
ORM abstracts database → OpenCode abstracts LLM
PostgreSQL/MySQL/SQLite → Claude/GPT/Gemini/Ollama
Same queries, different backend → Same commands, different provider

If you understand ORMs, you understand OpenCode's value.

items.title: Provider Configuration Understanding
items.content:
Beginner: "Which provider should I use?"
Intermediate: "How do I add a new provider?"
Advanced: "Different models for different task types"
Staff: "Cost optimization with model routing"
Expert: "Custom provider SDK integration"

items.title: Simplest OpenCode setup
items.content:
export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=... && opencode

That's it. No config file needed for basic use. Everything else is refinement.

items.title: OpenCode + Ollama
items.content:
Works: Full local execution, zero API costs, complete privacy.
Danger: Local models are smaller = less capable. Use for simple tasks, escalate to cloud for complex.

items.title: How multi-agent visibility fails
items.content:
1-2 agents: Manual switching works
3-4 agents: Frustrating but manageable
5-6 agents: Frequently miss idle agents
7+ agents: Chaos. Agents blocked for minutes while you check others.

RPAI fixes the gradient at any scale.

items.title: When manual management fails
items.content:
THE INFLECTION: 3 parallel agents

Below 3: Manual is fine
At 3: Start feeling friction
Above 3: RPAI ROI is immediate

Detection: Are you ever surprised an agent finished?

items.title: What if idle detection didn't exist?
items.content:
You'd design: Check each agent every N minutes.
Why this fails: Running agents don't need checks. Idle agents are urgent.
Hidden insight: Agent states have different urgency. One-size-fits-all checking wastes attention.

items.title: How RPAI value compounds
items.content:
Day 1: "Nice to see all agents"
Week 1: "Idle detection saves time"
Month 1: "Can't imagine parallel work without it"
Month 3: "RPAI is my agent operations center"

items.title: Checkpoints vs. Provider Flexibility
items.content:
Claude Code has: Checkpoints (instant rewind)
OpenCode has: Provider switching

THE TENSION: You can't have both. Checkpoints require deep Anthropic integration. Provider abstraction prevents it.

items.title: If you ignore cost economics
items.content:
IF: Use premium model for all tasks
THEN: $500/month on simple operations
THEN: Could be $50/month with model routing
FINALLY: 10x cost for same outcome

OpenCode enables the routing. Claude Code doesn't.

items.title: UNSOLVED: Automatic model routing
items.content: Optimal model per task is manual today. No AI-native routing layer exists. Each user makes case-by-case decisions. Opportunity for tooling.

items.title: Feature Mapping
items.content:
Claude Code checkpoints → Git commits in OpenCode
Claude Code thinking → Model-native in OpenCode
Claude Code subagents → @general/@explore in OpenCode
Claude Code skills → /skill in OpenCode

items.title: Enterprise agreement forces choice
items.content:
IF: Anthropic enterprise agreement
THEN: Usage commitments
THEN: Multi-provider defeats purpose
FINALLY: Claude Code is correct choice

OpenCode is for flexibility seekers, not committed enterprises.

items.content:

items.title: Other tools in the space
items.content:
Cursor: IDE-first approach
Aider: Git-native, conversation-based
Continue: IDE extension focused
GitHub Copilot CLI: GitHub ecosystem

items.title: Hybrid approach in production
items.content: Team uses Claude Code for complex reasoning tasks (code review, architecture), OpenCode for bulk operations (migrations, refactoring). Best of both worlds.

items.title: Multi-Provider Ralph
items.content:
Works: Planning phase with Opus, implementation with Codex, review with Gemini.
Danger: Model context differences can cause inconsistency. Keep tasks self-contained.

items.title: Gas Town = Microservices
items.content:
Mayor = API Gateway (routes requests)
Dogs = Worker services (process tasks)
Refinery = Quality service (validates output)
Different providers = Different runtime environments

OpenCode enables polyglot services.

items.title: Pattern evolution over time
items.content:
Month 1: Single provider Ralph
Month 3: OpenCode for cost optimization
Month 6: Multi-provider Gas Town
Year 1: Custom orchestration layer

items.title: If you skip RPAI for Gas Town
items.content:
IF: Run 6+ Dogs without visibility
THEN: Lose track of which finished
THEN: Dogs sit idle while you check others
FINALLY: Throughput drops 40%+

RPAI is not optional for Gas Town scale.

items.title: OpenCode config debugging difficulty
items.content:
Obvious: API key invalid → clear error
Subtle: Wrong model format → silent fallback
Hidden: Config merge order → global overwritten by project
Invisible: Provider cache stale → yesterday's config

Always opencode --log-level DEBUG when troubleshooting.

items.title: Why does RPAI need tmux?
items.content:
What if it didn't need tmux? Could use any terminal.
Why tmux: Session correlation. RPAI matches process → tmux pane to enable "jump to session."
Without tmux: Can show agents but can't navigate to them.

items.title: UNSOLVED: Cross-provider context
items.content: If task starts with Claude and continues with GPT, context doesn't transfer. No solution today. Manual file-based state is workaround.

items.title: Control vs. Convenience
items.content:
Full control (RPAI + OpenCode): You own everything, you configure everything
Full convenience (Claude Code): They handle it, you just use it

Most professionals land somewhere in between. Match to your needs.

items.title: Simplest alternative stack
items.content:
OpenCode + RPAI = complete Claude Code alternative

Two tools. Full functionality. Open source.

items.title: Cross-tool principle: External state wins
items.content: Claude Code, OpenCode, RPAI - all benefit from external state (files, git) over internal memory. The principle transfers across all tools.

items.title: Quick reference
items.content:
Best Claude experience → Claude Code
Provider flexibility → OpenCode
Cost optimization → OpenCode
Privacy/local → OpenCode + Ollama
Multi-agent visibility → Add RPAI
Open source → OpenCode + RPAI
Simplicity → Claude Code
